ko: 걔가 법학 학위를 딸 수 있을까?

en: She gets lost really easily. She's got no sense of direction.
ko: 걔는 길치라서 진짜 길을 잘 잃어버려.

en: She is beautiful and how!
Her dress has an understated charm.
She seems down lately.
She looks as if nothing had happened to her.
ko: 걔는 아무 일도 없었던 것처럼 보여.

en: What's wrong with her? She's looking kind of blue.
ko: 걔 왜 저래? 좀 우울해 보이네.

en: She was taken in by his manners.
ko: 걔는 그 사람 매너에 속아 넘어갔어.

en: He himself did it.
He himself went there.
He himself said so.
He lost his beloved son.
His powerful speech carried the audience with him.
ko: 그의 힘 있는 연설이 청중들을 사로잡았어.

en: He has spent most of his working life as a diplomat.
ko: 그는 평생의 대부분을 외교관으로 일하며 보냈어.

en: He's an odd man; so we'll have him referee.
ko: 그 사람은 좀 특이해서 우리가 심판을 맡기기로 했어.

en: He is nothing but a poet.
All but for he are here.
ko: 그 사람 빼고 다 여기 있어.

en: Everyone is here except for him.
Everybody except him thanked the critic for her honest opinion.
ko: 그 사람 빼고 다들 비평가의 솔직한 의견에 고마워했어.

en: Who should write it but himself?
ko: 그 사람 말고 누가 그걸 쓰겠어?

en: It is very difficult to make him out.
It's very difficult to understand him.
ko: 그를 이해하는 건 진짜 어려운 일이야.

en: It is up to you to support him.
Nobody ever praises him.
You should seclude him from temptation.
There wasn't enough evidence to convict him of the crime.
He reported fully what he had seen to the police.
ko: 그는 자기가 본 걸 경찰에 다 보고했어.

en: Don't arouse him from his sleep!
It's hard to please him.
ko: 그 사람 비위 맞추기 진짜 힘들어.

en: I expected that I would visit him, but I couldn't.
I was welcomed whenever I visited him.
When I called on him, he was not at home.
I couldn't bring myself to call on him.
ko: 도저히 그를 찾아갈 엄두가 안 났어.

en: When I called on him, he was hard at work.
ko: 찾아갔을 때 그는 한창 일하고 있더라고.

en: I can't let him alone.
ko: 그를 그냥 내버려 둘 수가 없어.

en: They buried him in his grave.
I doubt if he is a lawyer.
I spoke to him kindly so as not to frighten him.
Could I ask you to drive him to the hospital?
ko: 그를 병원까지 좀 태워다 줄 수 있어?

en: I'll take him with me to the hospital.
I must hasten to add that I do not mean to blame him.
I cannot find fault with him.
It is inevitable even if he is criticized.
ko: 그가 비판받는 건 피할 수 없는 일이야.

en: I am far from blaming him.
ko: 난 그를 비난할 생각 전혀 없어.

en: His repeated delinquencies brought him to court.
ko: 그는 반복되는 비행 때문에 결국 법정까지 갔어.

en: It was wise of you to keep away from him.
ko: 그를 멀리한 건 진짜 잘한 일이야.

en: You ought to walk a mile in his shoes before you criticize him.
ko: 비판하기 전에 먼저 그 사람 입장이 되어봐야 해.

en: Few, if any, will criticize him.
ko: 걔를 비판할 사람은 거의 없을 거야.

en: You can't mistake him for his younger brother.
Don't call him the criminal.
Don't call him an idiot.
Don't make a fool of him.
It is not his illness that ruined him so much as his idleness.
It was gambling that brought about his ruin.
Nothing but a full apology would satisfy him.
ko: 진심 어린 사과가 아니면 걔는 만족하지 않을 거야.

en: There are six people including him.
I gave no answer for fear I should confuse him.
ko: 걔를 헷갈리게 할까 봐 아무 대답도 안 했어.

en: You can rely upon him.
You must not shout at him.
I didn't say a word for fear I should annoy him.
ko: 걔 짜증 나게 할까 봐 한마디도 안 했어.

en: Try not to make him angry.
I called him to the telephone.
Would you mind calling him to the phone?
It is no exaggeration to call him a genius.
Don't make an enemy of him.
Through him I got acquainted with the big names of the town.
ko: 걔 덕분에 이 동네의 유명한 사람들을 알게 됐어.

en: I went after him, but I lost him in the crowd.
Give him time.
Bring him in.
Let him in.
Put him in.
Show him in.
The more I know him, the more I like him.
Not knowing him, I asked my sister about his job.
ko: 걔를 잘 몰라서 우리 언니한테 걔 직업이 뭔지 물어봤어.

en: Who that knows him will believe it?
ko: 걔를 아는 사람 중에 누가 그걸 믿겠어?

en: Those who know him speak well of him.
ko: 걔를 아는 사람들은 다들 걔 칭찬을 해.

en: All who knew him admired him.
ko: 걔를 알았던 사람들은 다들 걔를 존경했어.

en: Everyone who knew him admired him.
ko: 걔를 알던 모든 사람들이 걔를 우러러봤어.

en: Do I know him?
Whether you know him or not, you have to support his opinion.
ko: 네가 걔를 알든 모르든 걔 의견을 지지해야 해.

en: There is no possibility of our finding him.
All we can do is to wait for him.
ko: 우리가 할 수 있는 건 걔를 기다리는 것뿐이야.

en: All we can do is wait for him.
ko: 우리가 할 수 있는 건 걔를 기다리는 것뿐이야.

en: There was nothing that I could do but wait for him.
ko: 걔를 기다리는 것 말고는 내가 할 수 있는 게 없었어.

en: I am inclined to wait for him and start.
He is inclined to start at once, without waiting for him.
ko: 걔는 안 기다리고 바로 출발하고 싶어 해.

en: He is impossible to beat.
Some of his students admired him, and others despised him.
ko: 제자들 중 일부는 걔를 존경했고, 일부는 멸시했어.

en: We have no trust in him.
You're the only person that can persuade him.
ko: 걔를 설득할 수 있는 건 너밖에 없어.

en: We found it impossible to persuade him.
ko: 걔를 설득하는 건 불가능하다는 걸 알았어.

en: It is difficult, if not impossible, to persuade him.
ko: 불가능은 아니더라도 걔를 설득하는 건 힘들어.

en: It is absurd trying to persuade him.
ko: 걔를 설득하려고 하는 건 말도 안 돼.

en: There's no use trying to persuade him.
It is no use trying to persuade him.
I had a hard time trying to talk him out of taking the trip.
ko: 걔 여행 안 가게 말리느라 진짜 애먹었어.

en: It was difficult to persuade him to cancel the trip.
ko: 걔가 여행 취소하게 설득하는 건 힘들었어.

en: It was hard to persuade him to cancel the trip.
ko: 걔 여행 취소하게 설득하느라 진짜 힘들었어.

en: It was difficult to convince him to cancel the trip.
ko: 여행 취소하라고 걔 설득하는 거 정말 어렵더라.

en: I had a hard time trying to persuade him to cancel the trip.
ko: 걔 여행 취소하게 하려고 설득하느라 고생 좀 했어.

en: It took a long time to bring him around to our point of view.
ko: 우리 생각으로 걔 마음 돌리는 데 한참 걸렸어.

en: I wish I could have persuaded him to join us.
ko: 걔한테 같이 하자고 설득할 수 있었으면 좋았을 텐데.

en: I figure that there is no point in trying to persuade him.
I don't see any point in persuading him.
ko: 걔 설득하는 게 무슨 의미가 있나 싶어.

en: We couldn't get anywhere in our attempt to convince him.
ko: 걔 설득해 보려고 했는데 아무 소용 없었어.

en: I convinced him of his fault.
I tried to talk him out of the project, but in vain.
ko: 그 프로젝트 하지 말라고 말려봤는데 소용없었어.

en: In believing him to be an honest man, I was seriously in error.
ko: 걔가 정직한 사람이라고 믿은 게 내 큰 실수였어.

en: I erred in thinking him trustworthy.
ko: 걔를 믿을 만한 사람이라고 생각한 게 잘못이었어.

en: I was mistaken in thinking that he was a trustworthy man.
ko: 걔가 믿음직한 사람이라고 생각한 건 내 착각이었어.

en: Don't trust him.
You are very silly to trust him.
You're stupid to trust him.
ko: 걔를 믿는 건 바보 같은 짓이야.

en: You should not trust him.
You can trust him.
You can't trust him.
You ought not to believe him.
ko: 걔 말 믿지 않는 게 좋아.

en: You should have known better than to trust him.
I believe in him.
It is stupid of you to believe in him.
ko: 걔를 믿는 건 진짜 바보 같은 짓이야.

en: It was stupid of you to believe in him.
ko: 걔를 믿은 건 진짜 바보 같은 짓이었어.

en: Don't laugh at him.
It makes him a laughingstock.
There was no one who did not admire him.
You ought to have invited him, but you didn't.
You should have invited him, but you didn't.
I feel kind of sorry for him.
Outside of him, no one else came to the party.
ko: 걔 말고는 파티에 아무도 안 왔어.

en: With the exception of him, nobody else came to the party.
ko: 걔 빼고는 파티에 온 사람이 아무도 없어.

en: He was the only one who came to the party.
Do you hold him in great account?
He shall be fired.
We came to the conclusion that he should be fired.
Follow his example.
We adopt him as our representative.
We thought it impossible to stop him.
I made believe that I supported him.
I pretended to support him.
They acclaimed him their leader.
You should be careful not to bother him.
ko: 걔 귀찮게 안 하도록 조심해야 돼.

en: What's the accusation against him?
Can any girl like him?
I could hardly keep from liking him.
Some people like him and other people don't.
ko: 걔를 좋아하는 사람도 있고 안 좋아하는 사람도 있어.

en: It stands to reason that nobody likes him. He's too mean.
ko: 아무도 걔를 안 좋아하는 게 당연해. 너무 못됐거든.

en: It's natural that no one likes him. He's really mean.
ko: 걔를 좋아하는 사람이 없는 건 당연해. 진짜 못됐잖아.

en: It's not that I seriously like him. I just find him very attractive.
ko: 걔를 진심으로 좋아하는 건 아니고, 그냥 아주 매력 있다고 생각하는 거야.

en: To do him justice, he is not stupid.
To do him justice, he is a nice guy.
If you treat him fairly, he will be fair with you.
ko: 네가 걔한테 잘하면 걔도 너한테 잘할 거야.

en: His age didn't enter into our decision not to employ him.
ko: 걔 안 뽑기로 한 거 나이 때문은 아니었어.

en: When you employ him, you must make allowances for his youth.
ko: 걔를 쓰려면 아직 어리다는 건 감안해야 해.

en: Employing him would amount to employing nobody.
ko: 걔를 뽑는 건 아무도 안 뽑는 거나 마찬가지야.

en: I inquired after him.
Keep watch on him.
I have been to the station to see him off.
I have been to the airport to see him off.
I went to the airport to see him off.
To look at him, you could hardly believe it.
ko: 걔 겉모습만 봐서는 도저히 못 믿을 거야.

en: The instant I saw him I knew he was angry.
ko: 걔 보자마자 화난 거 딱 알겠더라.

en: Able was I ere I saw him.
ko: 걔 보기 전까진 나도 잘 나갔는데.

en: I cannot see him without thinking of my brother.
ko: 걔 볼 때마다 우리 형 생각나.

en: He reminds me of my grandfather.
When I see him, I think of my grandfather.
ko: 걔 볼 때마다 우리 할아버지 생각나.

en: The instant I saw him, I knew he was ill.
ko: 걔 보자마자 아픈 거 바로 알겠더라.

en: The moment I saw him, I knew he was angry.
ko: 걔 보는 순간 화났다는 거 바로 알았어.

en: I never see him without thinking of my son.
ko: 걔 볼 때마다 우리 아들 생각나.

en: I cannot help but sympathize with him any time I see him.
To look at him, you couldn't help laughing.
ko: 걔 보면 웃음을 참을 수가 없어.

en: Every time I looked at him, he was yawning.
Look at him. He's drunk again.
ko: 저것 좀 봐, 걔 또 취했어.

en: I don't see him.
As soon as I saw him, I burst into laughter.
I could not help laughing when I saw him.
Go and meet him, and while you're about it mail this letter.
ko: 가서 걔 좀 만나고, 가는 김에 이 편지도 좀 부쳐줘.

en: You'd better not make light of him.
We gave him a royal send-off at the airport.
ko: 공항에서 걔 진짜 거창하게 배웅해 줬어.

en: I saw him off at the airport.
You may call him a fool, but you cannot call him a coward.
ko: 걔가 바보일 순 있어도 겁쟁이는 아니야.

en: It never occurred to me to doubt him.
ko: 걔를 의심한다는 생각은 한 번도 안 해봤어.

en: We did not move for fear we should wake him up.
ko: 걔 깨울까 봐 꼼짝도 안 했어.

en: Let's receive him with a happy smile.
I couldn't help feeling sorry for him.
I can't pretend to like him.
He is hard to please.
It is difficult to make him happy.
There is a good argument for dismissing him.
ko: 걔 자를 만한 충분한 이유가 있어.

en: We failed to bring him to agree to our plan.
ko: 걔가 우리 계획에 찬성하게 설득 못 했어.

en: I managed to bring him around to my way of thinking.
ko: 겨우 걔를 내 생각에 동의하게 만들었어.

en: I don't blame you for hitting him.
ko: 네가 걔 때린 거 탓하지 않아.

en: It is incumbent on us to support him.
I accommodated him with a night's lodging.
Leave him alone.
I don't pretend to love him.
Whoever knows him well respects him.
ko: 걔를 잘 아는 사람이라면 다들 걔를 존경해.

en: All the more so to think well of him.
ko: 그러니까 걔를 더 좋게 생각하게 되는 거야.

en: Keep a close eye on him.
Watch him and do likewise.
ko: 걔 하는 거 보고 똑같이 해.

en: Watch him and do the same thing.
Watch him and do what he does.
ko: 걔가 어떻게 하는지 보고 그대로 해.

en: Cornering him in an argument is easy - like taking candy from a baby.
ko: 걔랑 말싸움해서 이기는 건 식은 죽 먹기야.

en: There was no one but admired him.
I planned to introduce him to Beatrice.
I went all the way to see him only to find him not at home.
ko: 걔 보러 거기까지 갔는데 집에 없더라.

en: I didn't invite him to the party. I feel guilty about it.
ko: 파티에 걔를 안 불렀더니 마음이 좀 찔리네.

en: Quiet him down, will you?
We cannot praise him too much.
The Stars must be kicking themselves for giving him the boot.
ko: 스타스는 걔 방출한 거 엄청 후회하고 있을 거야.

en: Don't stop him.
I feel like telling him what I think of him.
ko: 걔한테 내 솔직한 생각을 다 말해주고 싶어.

en: What do you make of him?
What do you think of him?
I must help him.
I caught a glimpse of him.
Have him wait a moment.
Don't take him in.
Don't deceive him.
Don't cheat him.
Nobody knows what it is that has been bothering him so much.
ko: 뭐가 걔를 그렇게 힘들게 하는지 아무도 몰라.

en: Dismiss him from that post.
I accommodated him for the night.
We have no call to appoint him to the post.
ko: 걔를 그 자리에 앉힐 이유가 전혀 없어.

en: I regard him as the best person for the job.
Don't blame him for the error.
ko: 그 실수 가지고 걔 탓하지 마.

en: He shan't go there.
ko: 걔 거기 못 가게 할 거야.

en: Let's call him Snoopy.
He shall go at once.
It was decided that he should be sent for at once.
Please let him come at once.
We decided to leave him alone for a while.
ko: 당분간 걔를 그냥 내버려 두기로 했어.

en: He shall be scolded.
I'll scold him.
There is no one that knows him who speaks ill of him.
ko: 걔를 아는 사람 중에 걔 욕하는 사람은 아무도 없어.

en: Did you know him?
He shall not come into this house again.
ko: 걔 다시는 이 집에 못 들어오게 할 거야.

en: I can't help making fun of him.
You should not make fun of him.
It is impudent of you to jest at him.
If you flatter him, he'll do anything.
ko: 걔는 비위만 잘 맞춰주면 뭐든 다 할 거야.

en: You may call him a liar, but you cannot call him a bad man.
ko: 걔가 거짓말쟁이일지는 몰라도 나쁜 사람은 아니야.

en: You ought not to treat him like that.
Shall I have him go with you?
ko: 걔 보고 너랑 같이 가라고 할까?

en: It seems a bit feudal to call him "sir".
ko: 걔를 '선생님'이라고 부르는 건 좀 너무 구식 같아.

en: They are very compatible.
They are mere creatures of habit.
ko: 걔네는 그냥 습관에 따라 움직이는 애들이야.

en: Although they are twins, they have few interests in common.
ko: 걔네는 쌍둥이인데도 공통 관심사가 거의 없어.

en: Not all of them are present.
They did not know it themselves.
They died one after another.
They look down on us as inexperienced young men.
They all tried to talk at one time.
They love each other.
Don't you like them any at all?
Do you really not like them?
Let them come in.
It is absurd to try to persuade them.
ko: 걔네 설득하려는 건 말도 안 돼.

en: Can you put them on the witness stand?
Will you help them?
Are you planning to help them?
Are you thinking of helping them?
There's no need to see them off.
They had to be turned away from the theater.
He gave me authority to fire them.
ko: 그 사람이 나한테 걔네 자를 권한 줬어.

en: It is our duty to help them.
We practiced very hard to beat them.
In order to beat them, we practice very hard.
ko: 걔네 이기려고 우리 진짜 열심히 연습해.

en: Don't make fun of them.
Do you mind their coming too?
Are they coming as well?
They may yet be happy.
They'll give in to us some day.
They are still seeking evidence.
I bought them each a present.
They're eating high on the hog.
They were walking along the street arm in arm.
ko: 걔네 팔짱 끼고 길을 걷고 있었어.

en: They walked along the avenue, arm in arm.
They came walking arm in arm.
They bribed the witness into silence.
ko: 걔네가 증인한테 뇌물 주고 입 막았어.

en: They stopped talking.
They are not of above taking bribes.
ko: 걔네 뇌물 충분히 받고도 남을 애들이야.

en: They were cut off in the middle of their telephone conversation.
They stopped to talk.
They can think and speak.
They sued for peace.

ko: 걔네 노인들한테 필요한 걸 배려 못 했어.

en: They will organize a labor union.
They guaranteed regular employment to their workers.
They are demanding shorter working hours.
ko: 걔네 노동 시간 줄여달라고 요구하고 있어.

en: They stood on the balcony to watch the festival in the street below.
